timeline.message:
AxeStrippingMapRegistry and Example

Switched single stripping map for a stripping map registry similar to how brewing is done.

Implement a system that fits into the current state of the Minecraft code.

Determine resultant state based on BlockState input and use some simple property copiers to match the data.

Generics fix

Incorrectly ordered them such that the input could extend the output and not vice versa. Fixes this issue.

Remove Original Solution

Remove stripping registry framework in place for new one

IForgeBlock Implementation

Hooks into all three tools.
Added Test Mod to verify event

finalState -> state and setter/getter one line

Extends BlockEvent so the other reviews are subject for review

Added specific ToolType implementation

Allows the user to specify which tooltypes to consider when using their custom tool.

Format Fixes and Reinventions of Static Helpers

Hopefully fixed all formatting errors?

Set<ToolType> -> ToolType

Axe, Hoe, Shovel now have static helpers

UseHoeEvent now deprecated, deprecate onHoeUse?

BlockToolInteractEvent needs to be either left alone to alter vanilla behavior or ported to a generic item use event somehow.

Ternary Operator Fix

Updated ForgeEventFactory::onToolUse to include ternary operator.

Ternary Operator Fix

Updated ForgeEventFactory::onToolUse to include ternary operator.

Update mods.toml

Exactly what it says to get the test mod loading.

Statics and Formats and Restructures, Oh my!

Made individual tool references public and called in IForgeBlock.

Fixed a bunch of formatting errors hopefully...

Added JavaDocs for all methods in BlockToolInteractEvent.

Deprecate ForgeEventFactory::onHoeUse

Deprecating references of UseHoeEvent.

Remove useless parameters

This should've happened earlier, I forgot to...oops.

All static helpers are reduced to only the state parameter.
